Observed on Am─Бv─Бsy─Б tithi of Caitraс╕е (lunar) month (aparaahna/vyaapti).  
┼Ъr─лkaс╣Зс╣нha, son of ┼Ъukadeva┼Ыharma on the banks of the river Kunс╕Н─л (Kunс╣н─л) was a dr─Бviс╕Нa (a southerner), eloquent, wellversed in scriptures and courageous; having received the initiation into asceticism from the compassionate preceptor Bodhendra with the name ┼Ъr─л Chandrac┼лс╕Нa, He held the responsibilities of preceptorship on earth by remaining in K─Бс╣Еci Maс╣нha. This preceptor surrounded by eminent scholarpoets Maс╣Еka, ┼Ъr─л Jayadeva, Kс╣Ыс╣гс╣Зa, Suhala, carrying out digvijaya throughout the earth defeated in debate the exponent of Jainism Hem─Бc─Бrya, whose presence embellished the assembly of King Vidy─Бlola Kum─Бrap─Бla. This preceptor ┼Ъr─л Chandrac┼лс╕Нa meditating on the mystic syllable that dispels grief/removes misery, adorning the seat (of preceptor) for sixty-eight years, became Videha by giving up the wondrous physical body on the New moon day in Caitra month of the year P─Бrthiva in the Kali era 4267. This renowned preceptor followed ┼Ъr─л Jayadeva, Kс╣Ыс╣гс╣Зami┼Ыra, Suhala and others, adored by King Jayasimha and Kum─Бrap─Бla, destroyed the arrogance of the Jaina exponent Hem─Бc─Бrya and attained the final beatitude at Aruс╣З─Бcala.

This accomplished knower of Brahman having got rid of the ignorance by the immaculate splendour of the moon-like ┼Ъuddh─Бnandamun─лndra, spreading the path of non-dualism protecting the world/earth for sixty-nine years, then approaching ┼Ъr─л┼Ыail─Б, on the way, attained blissful liberation on the ninth day of the dark fortnight in the month of R─Бdh─Б (Vai┼Ы─Бkha) of the year Krodhana.

Observed on ┼Ъukla-с╣вaс╣гс╣нh─л tithi of Jyaiс╣гс╣нhaс╕е (lunar) month (sunrise/puurvaviddha (default)).  
According to historical evidences, dated 22nd March 1540 CE, the Temple was brought to worship by doing Jeernoddhaarana by Chinni Thirumalacharyulu, the grandson of great saint Sri Talapaka Annamacharyulu. In 1940 CE. an Archaka Swamulu by name Sundararaju from Tamilnadu came to Srinivasa Mangapuram. He shared his dream with villagers by saying that in his dream Lord Venkateswara Swamy appeared and asked him to bring the temple to Past Vaibhavam (glorious) by performing Deepa Naivedya Aaradhana and Lord disppeared. As per the Lord words, Archaka Swami Sundaraju performed first pooja on July 1940 which was coincided on Ashada Shudda Shasti Day with the help of village elders. To mark the auspicious day of revival of Nitya Pooja Kainkaryam, TTD has been conducting this festival as Sakshatkara Vaibhavotsavam on Ashada Shuddha Shasti Day in the Jyaishta month every year.

#### рдХрд╛рдЮреНрдЪреА реирел рдЬрдЧрджреНрдЧреБрд░реБ рд╢реНрд░реА-рд╕рдЪреНрдЪрд┐рджрд╛рдирдиреНрджрдШрдиреЗрдиреНрджреНрд░ рд╕рд░рд╕реНрд╡рддреА рдЖрд░рд╛рдзрдирд╛

Observed on ┼Ъukla-Pratham─Б tithi of ─Ас╣г─Бс╕Нhaс╕е (lunar) month (aparaahna/vyaapti).  
The noble son of ┼Ъr─лkс╣Ыс╣гс╣Зa of ┼Ъr─лmuс╣гс╣Зa by name ┼Ъivas─Бmbha who went round the earth thrice, became a disciple of ┼Ъr─лcitrukha through initiation, and later became the head of ┼Ъr─л ┼Ъ─Бrada maс╣нha. He (┼Ъr─л Citsukhendra), whose biography was composed by Mantha in his work titled Siddhajaya adorned the P─лс╣нha for twenty-one years and attained immortal state. He, the austere, Saccid─Бnandaghana attained immortality in the form of ┼Ъivaliс╣Еga on the first day of the bright fortnight in the month of ─Ас╣г─Бс╕Нha of Prabhava year in the ┼Ъaka era 470.

### рдЙрддреНрд╕рд╡рд╛рдГ
#### рдХрд╛рдЮреНрдЪреА рейрез рдЬрдЧрджреНрдЧреБрд░реБ рд╢реНрд░реА-рдмреНрд░рд╣реНрдорд╛рдирдиреНрджрдШрдиреЗрдиреНрджреНрд░ рд╕рд░рд╕реНрд╡рддреА рдЖрд░рд╛рдзрдирд╛

Observed on ┼Ъukla-Dv─Бda┼Ы─л tithi of ─Ас╣г─Бс╕Нhaс╕е (lunar) month (aparaahna/vyaapti).  
Born on the banks of river Garuс╕Нa (Kaс╕Нilam in Tamil) in the Draviс╕Нa de┼Ыa (South India), as the son of Anant─Бrya, He was called Jyeс╣гс╣нarudra (before initiation). Having become the disciple of ┼Ъr─л Bodhendr─Бc─Бrya, He held with sincerity the responsibility of Preceptor-ship of the earth; worshipped by King Lalit─Бditya of Kashmir who conquered all rival kings on earth ┼Ъr─л Brahm─Бnandaghana attained liberation on dv─Бda┼Ы─л(twelfth day) of the bright fortnight of Jyeс╣гс╣нa in the year Prabhava. Well-versed in the six system of philosophy and adored/worshipped by the well-known poet Bhavabh┼лti and Kashmir monarch Lalit─Бditya, this preceptor adorned the P─лс╣нha for thirteen years and attained liberation in K─Б├▒ci itself.

Observed on ┼Ъukla-Da┼Ыam─л tithi of ┼Ъr─Бvaс╣Зaс╕е (lunar) month (aparaahna/vyaapti).  
┼Ъivar─Бmakс╣Ыс╣гс╣Зa, son of Parame┼Ыvara on the banks of river Pamp─Б, devoted to Sad─Б┼Ыiva, having got initiation into asceticism from him, devoid of any attachment indeed, He remained at the abode of goddess K─Бm─Бkс╣г─л. Devoted to the worship of ┼Ъr─л Cakrar─Бja, adhered to the path of ┼Ъivar─Бja, adhered to the path of ┼Ъivayoga, adept in worshipping the goddess K─Бme┼Ыvar─л, He, free from desires, held the preceptorship for fortyseven years. This senior preceptor, courageous, reached the space that is beyond the physical body, on the tenth day of the bright fortnight of the ┼Ъravaс╣Зa month in the year P─Бrthiva of the ┼Ъaka era 1508 (D┼лra ┼Ъaka). #### рдХрд╛рдЮреНрдЪреА реирез рдЬрдЧрджреНрдЧреБрд░реБ рд╢реНрд░реА-рд╕рд╛рд░реНрд╡рднреМрдордЧреБрд░реБрдГ рдЪрдиреНрджреНрд░рдЪреВрдбреЗрдиреНрджреНрд░ рд╕рд░рд╕реНрд╡рддреА рдЖрд░рд╛рдзрдирд╛

Observed on Kс╣Ыс╣гс╣Зa-Aс╣гс╣нam─л tithi of ┼Ъr─Бvaс╣Зaс╕е (lunar) month (aparaahna/vyaapti).  
Son of ┼Ъr─л Acyuta┼Ыarm─Б of Koс╣Еkaс╣Зade┼Ыa, having offered his services of preparing sandal paste for the worship of ┼Ъr─л Chandramoul─л┼Ыvara, He was offered kingship of Kashmir by King Harс╣гa for his poetical wisdom/merits. Having ruled Kashmir for a short period, He came back to his preceptor Arbhaka┼Ыaс╣Еkara and got initiated into asceticism with the name S─Бrvabhauma Chandrac┼лс╕Нendra Sarasvat─л. Preceptor ┼Ъr─л Chandrac┼лс╕Нendra Sarasvat─л leading for ten years a pious life on the banks of Ganges, establishing on his throne revered Madhura the incarnation of Dhanvantari and adorning him with the title Parip┼лrс╣Зabodha reached/attained his LordтАЩs immortal abode on the night of Kс╣Ыс╣гс╣Зajanm─Бс╣гс╣нam─л in the year Vijaya.

Observed on Kс╣Ыс╣гс╣Зa-с╣вaс╣гс╣нh─л tithi of Bh─Бdrapadaс╕е (lunar) month (aparaahna/vyaapti).  
This Saccid─Бnandaghana with a firm control over senses, conversant with various languagesтАФwas a Telugu brahmin named Timmaс╣Зс╣Зa, son of Prauс╕Нha R─Бmaс╣Зс╣Зa became the Jagadguru from region on the banks of river Chandrabh─Бga. Renovating the huge dilapidated maс╣нha, He remained happily in K─Б├▒ci itself by devoting himself every day in the worship of Goddess K─Бm─Бkс╣г─л. He, the benevolent great preceptor Saccid─Бnandaghana having travelled upto Himalayas attained liberation on the eighth day of bright fortnight of the month Bh─Бdrapada in the year Khara. He was also known as Bh─Бс╣гaparameс╣гс╣нi and his preceptorship was for twenty years.

#### рд╕рд┐рдиреНрдзреБ-рдЕрдиреНрддреНрдп-рдкреБрд╖реНрдХрд░-рдЖрд░рдореНрднрдГ

Coming from Brahma's Kamandalu, Pushkara Raja resides in different rivers, along with 3.5 crore tirthas, following the Sankranti of Guru, for twelve days at the beginning of the Sankranti (рдЖрджрд┐ рдкреБрд╖реНрдХрд░рдореН) and at the end of the year (preceding transition to the next рд░рд╛рд╢реА, рдЕрдиреНрддреНрдп рдкреБрд╖реНрдХрд░рдореН), and for two muhurtas during mid-day, every day, during the entire year.
 Following the transition of Guru to рдзрдиреБрдГ рд░рд╛рд╢реА, рдкреБрд╖реНрдХрд░рд░рд╛рдЬ resides in рд╕рд┐рдиреНрдзреБ river.

рдпрджрд╛ рд░рд╛рд╢рд┐-рдкреНрд░рд╡реЗрд╢рдГ рд╕реНрдпрд╛рддреНрддрджрд╛ рдкреНрд░рднреГрддрд┐ рд╕рд░реНрд╡рджрд╛ред

He, the adept in Yoga reinstating compassionately the Kannada prince who lost kith and kin in his own kingdom through his (the princeтАЩs) conqueror, He (Cid─Бnandaghanendra) remained as preceptor only for four years sustaining on dry leaves. рдХрд╖реНрдЯрд╛рдиреНрдорд╛рдВ рдореЛрдЪрдпреЗрд╢рд╛рди рд╕рд░реНрд╡рдорд┐рд╖реНрдЯрдВ рдЪ рджреЗрд╣рд┐ рдореЗрее

Son of B─Бlacandrasuta named S┼лryan─Бr─Бyaс╣Зa, ┼Ъr─л Vidy─Бghanade┼Ыika was the disciple of ┼Ъr─л Cid─Бnanda. The preceptor ┼Ъr─л Vidy─Бghana, mastering the ┼Ъr─лvidy─Б held the responsibilities of the preceptor despite the atrocities of Turuс╣гkas for thirty years. The staunch adherent of asceticism, He reached the highest state of Bliss on the second day of the black fortnight in the month of Puс╣гya in the year Prabhava. This preceptor Vidy─Бghana, searching a worthy disciple to adorn the seat of the P─лс╣нha, reached Cidambaram where He handed over the responsibilities of governing (the Maс╣нha) to Dh─лra┼Ыaс╣Еkarendra and attained siddhi there itself. His preceptorship was for thirty years.

#### рдЕрдЩреНрдЧрд╛рд░рдХреА-рджреНрд╡рд┐рдЬрдкреНрд░рд┐рдп-рдорд╣рд╛рдЧрдгрдкрддрд┐ рд╕рдЩреНрдХрдЯрд╣рд░-рдЪрддреБрд░реНрдереА-рд╡реНрд░рддрдореН

Special vrata day for Ganesha. In this month, Ganesha is worshipped as рджреНрд╡рд┐рдЬрдкреНрд░рд┐рдп-рдорд╣рд╛рдЧрдгрдкрддрд┐рдГ. Fast during the day and pray to Ganesha after moonrise, as follows:When `caturthI` occurs on a Tuesday, it is known as `aGgArakI` and is even more sacred.
#### рдЕрдЩреНрдЧрд╛рд░рдХ-рдЪрддреБрд░реНрдереА

рдЪрддреБрд░реНрдереА рддрд┐рдерд┐ on a Tuesday is as sacred as a solar eclipse. Good day for doing puja of Ganesha/Subrahmanya with naivedyam of modakam/millet flour respectively.
